general_advisory: There is a chance of occurrence of light to moderate rainfall along with heavy rainfall in one or two places with thunderstorm and lightning in upcoming days. Prevailing weather condition is favourable for various diseases and sucking insect pest attacks in different crops. Farmers are advised to conduct spraying operations before the predicted rainfall and keep animals away from electrical equipment.

advisory: In case of no rainfall condition, farmers should apply one irrigation at this stage to maintain 5 cm water level in rice field.

After rainfall, there may be a chance of infestation of sheath blight and sheath rot disease in rice field. To control these diseases, farmers should spray Trifloxystrobin 25% + Tebuconazole 50% WG @ 80 g or, Propiconazole 25% @ 200 ml or, Hexaconazole 5 % SC @ 250 ml in 200 litres of water per acre. Repeat the spray at 7-10 daysâ€™ interval.
To control the flower drop in cotton crop, application of Planofix @ 90 ml in 200 liters of water per acre after 60-65 days after sowing of seed.

To control sucking insect pest (Aphid, Thrips etc.) attack in cotton crop, application of Neem-based pesticide like Neem oil @ 600-800 ml + 200g detergent powder per acre by mixing with 200 liters of water should be advised at 30-45 days crop stage under clear weather.
At the initial stage of flowering, farmers should avoid any chemical application in cotton crop.
If sucking insect pest attack is noticed, then spraying of thiamethoxam @ 0.2 g or imidacloprid @ 0.33 ml per liter of water should be advised.
For controlling some diseases like wilt, root rot etc., farmers should use Carbendazim @ 2g or copper oxicloride @ 3ml per liter water under no rainfall condition.

Prevailing weather condition is favourable for thrip attack in Banana plant. At the initial stage, cover or wrap the bundle with a jute bag, areas should be weed-free, and use 15-20 no. of blue sticky cards per acre should be advised to control this insect. For chemical control, spraying of Diafenthiuron 50% WP @ 2g per liter (twice at 15 days interval) should be advised.

Mastitis disease is observed in some animals at present conditions, which may hamper milk production and quality. Preventive measures like pre and post dipping with antiseptic liquids, proper sanitation, preventing wet floor surface, feeding during and just after milking to avoid sitting of animals before closure of teat sphincters, lime application on the resting floor, providing a mixture of 2 lemons and 200g sugar in one liter of water at morning and evening hours should be taken to control this disease. Freshwater availability should be ensured on the farm.
